en: Seemona and Daniel Whaley kept watching the smoke, thinking the fire was still far away. Their cat hovered near the heating vent because smoke was coming in through the vents. Finally, they could see that one of the lodges below them was on fire. Someone called and told them to leave now. They had a hard time escaping, having waited almost too long to leave. A fallen tree that was on fire beside the road blocked the way out. They could see one of their friends’ houses in flames.

This video examines Paige Braddock's artwork "Escaping the Fire", which was inspired by the experiences of Seemona Whaley and Daniel Whaley during the Chimney Tops 2 Wildfires. During the wildfires the Whaleys kept watching the smoke, thinking the fire was still far away. Their cat hovered near the heating vent because smoke was coming in through the vents. Finally, they could see that one of the lodges below them was on fire. Someone called and told them to leave now. They had a hard time escaping, having waited almost too long to leave. A fallen tree that was on fire beside the road blocked the way out. They could see one of their friends’ houses in flames.
